item.title: 巴西禁令危及中国蓬勃发展的鸡爪市场
item.description: 鸡爪在点心店的菜单上无处不在，也是一种很受欢迎的街头小吃，但鸡爪价格的飙升却有可能让许多中国消费者望而却步。【原文：They’re ubiquitous on dim sum restaurant menus, and a popular street food snack, but a surge in chicken feet prices is threatening to put them out of reach of many Chinese consumers.】

item.title: 比特币奖励公司 Fold 据称接近与贝特西-科恩 SPAC 达成交易
item.description: 据知情人士透露，比特币奖励公司 Fold Inc.【原文：Fold Inc., the Bitcoin reward firm, is in advanced talks to go public via a blank-check company started by SPAC veteran Betsy Cohen, according to people with knowledge of the matter.】

item.title: 债券市场发生叛变，亿万富翁挑起债务战
item.description:
与帕特里克-德拉希（Patrick Drahi）和保罗-库尔森（Paul Coulson）等欧洲富豪的激烈交锋意味着 许多债权人发誓，他们再也不会支持这些人了。【原文：

Bruising encounters with European tycoons like Patrick Drahi and Paul Coulson mean many creditors are vowing that they’ll never back such individuals again.

】

item.title: 非洲国家转向黄金以抵御货币损失
item.description: 地缘政治紧张局势重创了非洲国家的货币，并助长了通货膨胀。【原文：African nations are rushing to build their gold reserves to hedge against geopolitical tensions that have battered their currencies and fanned inflation.】

item.title: 香港山顶豪宅以 1.1 亿美元售出，家族出售资产
item.description: 山顶上的三栋房屋以 8.6 亿港元（1.1 亿美元）的价格售出，这是一个月内香港富裕家庭的第二笔大宗交易。【原文：Three houses on the Peak have been sold for HK$860 million ($110 million), the second big transaction in a month by a wealthy family in Hong Kong.】

item.title: 支持加密货币的特朗普导致比特币与全球股市分化
item.description: 比特币和全球股市正出现分化，因为唐纳德-特朗普在选举中的推动和对加密货币的紧紧拥抱支撑着这一最大的数字资产，而股市则因公司盈利前景不明而摇摆不定。【原文：Bitcoin and global stocks are diverging as Donald Trump’s electoral push and tightening embrace of crypto bolster the largest digital asset while equities waver on an uncertain outlook for company earnings.】

item.title: 中国从西藏调来官员领导打击银行家行动
item.description: 中国从西藏调派了一名官员来领导对金融业的打击，这表明其清理金融业的空前努力并未放松。【原文：China relocated an official from Tibet to lead its crackdown on the financial sector, indicating no let-up in its unprecedented efforts to clean up the industry.】

item.title: 信实集团获美国批准恢复从委内瑞拉进口原油
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，尽管白宫对委内瑞拉实施了制裁，但信实工业有限公司已获得美国批准，恢复从该国进口石油。【原文：Reliance Industries Ltd. has secured US approval to resume importing oil from Venezuela despite White House sanctions on the country, according to people familiar with the development.】

item.title: 印度房地产股票在预算案后感受到热度
澳大利亚监管机构成立新部门，加强对私募市场的关注
item.description: 澳大利亚企业监管机构成立了一个专门机构，负责在未来 12 个月内与私人市场接触，因为该行业的估值问题一直备受关注。【原文：Australia’s corporate regulator has set up a specialized unit to engage with private markets over the next 12 months, amid persistent concerns about valuations in the sector.】

item.title: 家居用品零售商 Conn's 因销售额下降申请破产
item.description: 家具零售商 Conn's Inc. 已申请破产，原因是销售不景气和整合竞争对手连锁店遇到麻烦。【原文：Furniture retailer Conn’s Inc. has filed for bankruptcy amid lagging sales and trouble integrating a rival chain.】

item.title: 股价短暂反弹后，百度的 "Robotaxi "雄心引来质疑者
item.description: 中国自动驾驶技术的普及速度快于预期，但这并没有给正在寻找百度公司下一个催化剂的分析师们带来乐观情绪。【原文：China’s faster-than-expected adoption of autonomous driving is doing little to rev up optimism among analysts searching for Baidu Inc.’s next catalyst.】

item.title: 澳大利亚监管机构负责人称对澳新银行交易的调查可能持续到明年
item.description: 澳大利亚市场监管机构表示，对澳新银行集团控股有限公司（ANZ Group Holdings Ltd. ）市场部门违规行为的调查要到今年年底或 2025 年初才能结束。【原文：Australia’s markets regulator said its investigation into irregularities in ANZ Group Holdings Ltd.’s markets unit won’t conclude until the end of this year or early 2025.】

item.title: 台风盖米淹没马尼拉，台湾和菲律宾关闭市场
item.description: 由于台风盖米袭击马尼拉并向台北袭来，菲律宾和台湾于周三关闭了金融市场、学校和办公室。【原文：The Philippines and Taiwan have closed financial markets, schools and offices on Wednesday as Typhoon Gaemi lashed Manila and barreled toward Taipei.】

item.title: 印度预算的五张主要图表：增加支出，控制债务
item.description: 印度财政部长尼尔马拉-西塔拉曼（Nirmala Sitharaman）周二发表了她的第七份预算报告，承诺在控制财政赤字的同时创造更多就业机会，增加基础设施支出。【原文：Indian Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman delivered her seventh budget speech on Tuesday, pledging to create more jobs, boost spending on infrastructure while still reining in the fiscal deficit.】

item.title: 多年资金外流后，马来西亚推动人工智能吸引股票投资者
item.description: 经过多年的回避，马来西亚股市正在重新获得全球投资者的青睐。【原文：After years of getting shunned, Malaysia’s stock market is regaining favor with global investors.】

item.title: 巴伦乔伊公司希望加快澳大利亚 IPO 进程以促进上市
item.description: 澳大利亚顶级投资银行之一 Barrenjoey 正在推动加快公司在悉尼上市的进程，主张采用美国式的申请系统，对一些关键细节保密。【原文：Barrenjoey, one of Australia’s top investment banks, is pushing for a quicker process to get companies listed in Sydney, advocating for a US-style application system that keeps some key details confidential.】

item.title: 开始一天生活所需的五件事亚洲
item.description: 早上好。美国股市未能获得牵引力。LVMH 销售增长放缓。私募股权基金发挥创意，争取更多时间。市场动态如下。【原文：Good morning. US stocks fail to gain traction. LVMH sales growth slows. Private equity gets creative to buy more time. Here’s what’s moving markets. — Isabelle Lee】

item.title: 报告指出美国将减少石油库存，石油止住四日跌势
item.description: 在一份行业报告显示美国原油库存连续第四周下降后，石油上涨，结束了连续下跌的势头。【原文：Oil rose, snapping a run of losses, after an industry report indicated that US crude inventories fell for a fourth week.】

item.title: 大型科技公司业绩令人失望，亚洲股市承压：市场综述
item.description: 在 "七大科技公司"（Magnificent Seven）的财报不尽如人意之后，亚洲股市准备平开或低开。【原文：Asian stocks were poised to open flat to lower, following an unimpressive start to the earnings reports from the “Magnificent Seven” megacap technology companies.】

item.title: 台风盖米导致台湾和菲律宾的市场和学校关闭
item.description: 受台风 "盖米 "影响，菲律宾政府取消了首都的工作和学校，菲律宾股票和货币市场周三暂停交易。【原文：The Philippines suspended trading in its stocks and currency markets on Wednesday after the government canceled work and schools in the capital due to Typhoon Gaemi.】

item.title: 美国高等级债券销售量创六年来最大七月纪录
item.description: 本月，蓝筹股公司出售债券的速度是六年来任何一个七月中最快的，这是因为投资者希望在美联储开始降息之前锁定高收益率，因而需求旺盛。【原文：Blue-chip companies sold bonds this month at the fastest rate for any July in six years, harnessing strong demand from investors looking to lock in high yields before the Federal Reserve starts cutting rates.】

item.title: Blackstone 押注美国以外地区私人信贷业务增长
item.description: Blackstone Inc. 全球信贷主管表示，该公司正 "加倍努力 "抓住其国际信贷业务中的机遇，因为其目标是在包括本币投资在内的更广泛的债务领域实现增长。【原文：Blackstone Inc. is “doubling down” on opportunities in its international credit business, as it targets growth in a broader array of debt including local-currency investments, according the firm’s global credit head.】

item.title: 中国经济放缓对欧洲利润的影响日益严重
item.description: 从奢侈品牌到汽车制造商，欧洲企业正受到中国经济放缓的冲击，而严重依赖亚洲经济大国需求的企业也将面临更多麻烦。【原文：From luxury brands to car makers, European companies are taking a hit from China’s slowdown, and more trouble is coming for businesses heavily reliant on demand in the Asian economic giant.】

item.title: 印度视频市场到 2028 年将增至 130 亿美元
item.description: 据一份新报告称，在流媒体行业的推动下，印度视频市场的收入预计到 2028 年将达到 130 亿美元，该行业每年在内容开发方面持续投入数十亿美元。【原文：India’s video market is expected to reach $13 billion in revenue by 2028, boosted by the streaming industry, which has continued to invest billions of dollars in content development every year, according to a new report.】

item.title: TC 能源公司即将向土著组织出售天然气管道股权
item.description: 在阿尔伯塔省政府的帮助下，TC 能源公司即将达成一项协议，向加拿大西部的土著社区出售天然气管道系统的股份。【原文：TC Energy Corp. is nearing a deal to sell a stake in a natural gas pipeline system to indigenous communities in Western Canada, with help from Alberta’s government.】

item.title: OneStream 首次公开募股融资 4.9 亿美元，定价高于区间
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，OneStream Inc.和包括 KKR & Co.在内的一批股东在美国首次公开募股中筹集了约 4.9 亿美元，股票定价高于市场范围。【原文：OneStream Inc. and a group of shareholders including KKR & Co. raised about $490 million in a US initial public offering, pricing its shares above a marketed range, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 澳元兑日元面临更大跌幅风险，因 CPI 与日本央行一致
item.description: 根据下周两个关键事件的结果：当地通胀数据和日本央行会议，澳元兑日元有可能延续跌势。【原文：Australia’s dollar is at risk of extending its slide against the yen based on the outcome of two crucial events next week: local inflation data and a Bank of Japan meeting.】

item.title: First Quantum 与中国股东达成停产协议
item.description: 第一量子矿业有限公司（First Quantum Minerals Ltd.）与其第二大股东江西铜业股份有限公司（Jiangxi Copper Co Ltd.）达成协议，限制中国公司对这家加拿大铜生产商的所有权。【原文：First Quantum Minerals Ltd. reached an agreement with Jiangxi Copper Co Ltd., its second-largest shareholder, that limits the Chinese firm’s ownership of the Canadian copper producer.】

item.title: 英国称银行必须在分行关闭后保留现金存取权
item.description: 英国最大的 14 家银行中，包括汇丰控股有限公司（HSBC Holdings Plc）、巴克莱银行有限公司（Barclays Plc）和英国国家西敏寺银行集团有限公司（NatWest Group Plc），必须确保当地社区仍能方便地获得现金，英国金融监督机构表示，由于当地分支机构的关闭潮威胁到了弱势客户。【原文：Fourteen of the UK’s largest banks, including HSBC Holdings Plc, Barclays Plc and NatWest Group Plc, must ensure local communities can still easily access cash, the country’s financial watchdog said, as a wave of local branch closures threaten vulnerable customers.】
